titlestmt.author: Compiled by Helen Chillman and Robert Carlucci

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Saturday December 8, 2018 at 00:21

did.abstract: Collection of mounted color and black and white labeled photographs covering a broad range of teaching materials for sub-Saharan African, Afro-Caribbean and African American art and architecture. Many items in the collection donated by Professor Robert Thompson, or acquired at his request.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright has not been transferred to Yale University. Further use of this material may be subject to the copyright laws of the United States (Title 17, United States Code) or to site license or other rights management terms or conditions.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Collection of mounted color and black and white labeled photographs covering a broad range of teaching materials for sub-Saharan African, Afro-Caribbean and African American art and architecture. Many items in the collection donated by Professor Robert Thompson, or acquired at his request.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged geographically and, within geographic regions, by indigenous ethnic groups.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Two folders of clippings and unprocessed material

did.unittitle: Sculpture by Abatan Odefunke Ayinke Ija (c.1885-1969)

odd.head: General
odd.p: Various artists: single examples of the work of T.Ajiboye, Walter Battiss, Chaurika, D.Dale, Cecil Higgs, Maggie Laubser, Festus Idehen, Koffi Kouakou, Thomas Mukarobowa, Nicholas Mukomberanwa, Henry Mubzengerere, Sylvester Mubayi, Joseph Ndandarika, Hugo Naude, Sam Ntiro, Bruce Onobrakpeya, Kolade Oshinowo, Cheri Samba, Irma Stern, Madge Tennent, Yoni Waite
